data: Problemi e ipotesi sulla lingua dei graffiti di Segesta
R. Ambrosini, «Problemi e ipotesi sulla lingua dei graffiti di Segesta», Rendiconti della Classe di Scienze Morali, Storiche e Filologiche dell’Accademia dei Lincei 25 (1970): 461–74
The drawing is placed on the outer surface of the wall.
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana
Ambrosini, 1970, Problemi e ipotesi sulla lingua dei graffiti di Segesta
Tusa, 1970, Frammenti di ceramica con graffiti da Segesta V
1unspecified
The drawing is placed on the outer surface of the wall. The drawing has been highlighted with white painting in modern times to make it more legible.
The drawing is placed on the inside of the wall and has been highlighted with white painting in modern times to make it more visible.
The sign is placed on the underside of the foot. The sign has been highlighted with white painting in modern times to make it more legible.
1⧖

The text is placed on the underside of the foot. Another scratch, perhaps a five-pointed star or an hourglass mark, is on a broken part of the fragment.
                                        The drawings have been highlighted with white painting in modern times to make them more legible.

1sign, uninterpreted
The signs are placed on the underside of the foot. They have been highlighted with white painting in modern times to make them more legible.
1#figure_anthropomorphicΑ
On a surface not clearly identifiable. The sign has been highlighted with white painting in modern times to make it more legible.
The text is placed on the underside of the foot. The sign has been highlighted with white painting in modern times to make it more legible.
1val01 (uncertain interpretation)

The text consists of two inscriptions, arranged on two different parts of the same object. The first (a) is on the underside of the foot: it consists of five letters arranged in one line and a fifth letter not aligned with the others. It has been highlighted with white painting in modern times to make it more legible. The second (b) is on the bottom of the interior of the cup and consists of three letters not aligned with each other.
Tusa, 1970, A proposito di una recente pubblicazione sulla lingua dei graffiti di Segesta
